jade.security
Interface JADEAuthority

All Known Implementing Classes:
JADEAuthorityDummyImpl, JADEAuthorityImpl
public interface JADEAuthority

The Authority interface represents an authority. It has methods for signing certificates and for verifying their validity.

Version:
$Date: 2004-07-21 17:18:27 +0200 (mer, 21 lug 2004) $ $Revision: 459 $
Author:
Giosue Vitaglione - Telecom Italia LAB, Nicolas Lhuillier - Motorola

Method Summary
 byte[] decrypt(SecurityObject so, byte[] enc)
          Decrypt the obfucated text enc, using the information (e.g. wrapped-key, etc.)
 byte[] encrypt(SecurityObject so, byte[] text, jade.security.JADEPrincipal recKey)
          Encrypt the clear text using the information (e.g. algorithm, strength, etc.) contained in the SecurityObject for the given Principal (i.e. using this Principal's public-key).
 jade.security.JADEPrincipal getJADEPrincipal()
          Returns the JADEPrincipal for this Authority
 void init(java.lang.String authorityName, jade.core.Profile prof, jade.security.Credentials creds)
          Initialize the authority by reading the configuration parameters from the Profile
 SecurityData sign(java.lang.String algorithm, byte[] text)
          Signs the raw text following the information (e.g. algorithm, etc.)
 boolean verifySignature(SecurityData signature, byte[] text)
          Verify that the signature contained in the SecurityObject is a valid signature for the given text.

the signature

encrypt

byte[] encrypt(SecurityObject so,
               byte[] text,
               jade.security.JADEPrincipal recKey)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Encrypt the clear text using the information (e.g. algorithm, strength, etc.) contained in the SecurityObject for the given Principal (i.e. using this Principal's public-key).

Returns:
the encrypted text
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

decrypt

byte[] decrypt(SecurityObject so,
               byte[] enc)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Decrypt the obfucated text enc, using the information (e.g. wrapped-key, etc.) contained in the SecurityObject. Note that this method uses this authority's public-key to unwrap the symmetric encryption key.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
